description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Poison-type moves.

name: Earth Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Ground-type moves.

name: Sky Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Flying-type moves.

name: Mind Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Psychic-type moves.

name: Insect Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Bug-type moves.

name: Stone Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Rock-type moves.

name: Spooky Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Ghost-type moves.

name: Draco Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Dragon-type moves.

name: Dread Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Dark-type moves.

name: Iron Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Steel-type moves.

name: Odd Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is\nan exotic-smelling incense that boosts\nthe power of Psychic-type moves.

name: Rock Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is\nan exotic-smelling incense that boosts\nthe power of Rock-type moves.

name: Full Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is\nan exotic-smelling incense that makes\nthe holder bloated and slow moving.

name: Wave Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is\nincense with a curious aroma that\nboosts the power of Water-type moves.

name: Rose Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is\nan exotic-smelling incense that boosts\nthe power of Grass-type moves.

name: Luck Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt doubles a battle's prize money if\nthe holding Pokémon joins in.

name: Pure Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt helps keep wild Pokémon away if the\nholder is the first one in the party.

name: Protector
description: A protective item of some sort.\nIt is extremely stiff and heavy.\nIt is loved by a certain Pokémon.

name: Electirizer
description: A box packed with a tremendous\namount of electric energy.\nIt is loved by a certain Pokémon.

name: Magmarizer
description: A box packed with a tremendous\namount of magma energy.\nIt is loved by a certain Pokémon.

name: Dubious Disc
description: A transparent device overflowing with\ndubious data.\nIts producer is unknown.

name: Reaper Cloth
description: A cloth imbued with horrifyingly strong\nspiritual energy.\nIt is loved by a certain Pokémon.

name: Razor Claw
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a sharply hooked claw that ups\nthe holder's critical-hit ratio.

name: Razor Fang
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt may make foes and allies flinch\nwhen the holder inflicts damage.

name: TM01
description: The user sharpens its claws to\nboost its Attack stat and accuracy.

name: TM02
description: The user slashes the target with huge,\nsharp claws.

name: TM03
description: The user materializes an odd\npsychic wave to attack the target.\nThis attack does physical damage.

name: TM04
description: The user quietly focuses its mind and\ncalms its spirit to raise its Sp. Atk\nand Sp. Def stats.

name: TM05
description: The target is scared off and replaced\nby another Pokémon in its party.\nIn the wild, the battle ends.

name: TM06
description: A move that leaves the target badly\npoisoned. Its poison damage\nworsens every turn.

name: TM07
description: Summons a hailstorm that lasts for\nfive turns. The hailstorm damages\nall types except Ice.

name: TM08
description: The user tenses its muscles to bulk up\nits body, boosting both its Attack and\nDefense stats.

name: TM09
description: The user drenches the target in a\nspecial poisonous liquid. Its power\nis doubled if the target is poisoned.

name: TM10
description: A unique attack that varies in type and\nintensity depending on the Pokémon\nusing it.

name: TM11
description: The user intensifies the sun for\nfive turns, powering up Fire-type\nmoves.

name: TM12
description: The target is taunted into a rage that\nallows it to use only attack moves\nfor three turns.

name: TM13
description: The target is struck with an icy-cold\nbeam of energy.\nIt may also freeze the target solid.

name: TM14
description: A howling blizzard is summoned to strike\nthe opposing team. It may also freeze\nthem solid.

name: TM15
description: The target is attacked with a powerful\nbeam. The user must rest on the next\nturn to regain its energy.

name: TM16
description: A wondrous wall of light is put up to\nsuppress damage from special attacks\nfor five turns.

name: TM17
description: It enables the user to evade all\nattacks. Its chance of failing rises\nif it is used in succession.

name: TM18
description: The user summons a heavy rain that\nfalls for five turns, powering up\nWater-type moves.

name: TM19
description: The user makes the target float with\nits psychic power. The target is easier\nto hit for three turns.

name: TM20
description: The user creates a protective field\nthat prevents status problems\nfor five turns.

name: TM21
description: A full-power attack that grows more\npowerful the less the user likes its\nTrainer.

name: TM22
description: A two-turn attack. The user gathers\nlight, then blasts a bundled beam on\nthe second turn.

name: TM23
description: The user throws a stone or projectile\nto attack an opponent. A flying Pokémon\nwill fall to the ground when it's hit.

name: TM24
description: A strong electric blast is loosed at the\ntarget. It may also leave the target\nwith paralysis.

name: TM25
description: A wicked thunderbolt is dropped\non the target to inflict damage. It may\nalso leave the target with paralysis.

name: TM26
description: The user sets off an earthquake that\nstrikes every Pokémon around it.

name: TM27
description: A full-power attack that grows more\npowerful the more the user likes its\nTrainer.

name: TM28
description: The user burrows, then attacks on the\nsecond turn. It can also be used to\nexit dungeons.

name: TM29
description: The target is hit by a strong\ntelekinetic force. It may also reduce\nthe target's Sp. Def stat.

name: TM30
description: The user hurls a shadowy blob at the\ntarget. It may also lower the target's\nSp. Def stat.

name: TM31
description: The user attacks with tough fists,\netc. It can also break any barrier\nsuch as Light Screen and Reflect.

name: TM32
description: By moving rapidly, the user makes\nillusory copies of itself to raise\nits evasiveness.

name: TM33
description: A wondrous wall of light is put up to\nsuppress damage from physical attacks\nfor five turns.

name: TM34
description: It swamps the area around the user\nwith a giant sludge wave.\nIt may also poison those hit.

name: TM35
description: The target is scorched with an intense\nblast of fire. It may also leave the\ntarget with a burn.

name: TM36
description: Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the\ntarget. It may also poison the target.

name: TM37
description: A five-turn sandstorm is summoned\nto hurt all combatants except the\nRock, Ground, and Steel types.

name: TM38
description: The target is attacked with an intense\nblast of all-consuming fire. It may\nalso leave the target with a burn.

name: TM39
description: Boulders are hurled at the target. It\nalso lowers the target's Speed by\npreventing its movement.

name: TM40
description: The user confounds the target\nwith speed, then slashes.\nThe attack lands without fail.

name: TM41
description: The user torments and enrages the\ntarget, making it incapable of using the\nsame move twice in a row.

name: TM42
description: An attack move that doubles its power\nif the user is poisoned, paralyzed, or\nhas a burn.

name: TM43
description: The user cloaks itself with flame and\nattacks. Building up more power,\nit raises the user's Speed stat.

name: TM44
description: The user goes to sleep for two\nturns. It fully restores the user's HP\nand heals any status problem.

name: TM45
description: If it is the opposite gender of the\nuser, the target becomes infatuated\nand less likely to attack.

name: TM46
description: The user attacks and steals the\ntarget's held item simultaneously. It\ncan't steal if the user holds an item.

name: TM47
description: The user attacks the target's legs\nswiftly, reducing the target's\nSpeed stat.

name: TM48
description: The user attacks the target with a\nsong. Others can join in the Round and\nmake the attack do greater damage.

name: TM49
description: The user attacks the target with an\nechoing voice. If this move is used\nevery turn, it does greater damage.

name: TM50
description: The user attacks the target at full\npower. The attack's recoil harshly\nreduces the user's Sp. Atk stat.

name: TM51
description: The user teleports using a strange\npower and switches its place with one of\nits allies.

name: TM52
description: The user heightens its mental focus and\nunleashes its power.\nIt may also lower the target's Sp. Def.

name: TM53
description: The user draws power from nature and\nfires it at the target. It may also\nlower the target's Sp. Def.

name: TM54
description: A restrained attack that prevents the\ntarget from fainting. The target is left\nwith at least 1 HP.

name: TM55
description: The user shoots boiling hot water at\nits target. It may also leave the\ntarget with a burn.

name: TM56
description: The user flings its held item at the\ntarget as an attack. Its power and\neffects depend on the item.

name: TM57
description: The user attacks with an electric\ncharge. The user may use any remaining\nelectricity to raise its Sp. Atk stat.

name: TM58
description: The user hurls the target into the air,\nthen drops it on the second turn. The\ntarget cannot attack while in the air.

name: TM59
description: The user attacks the target with fire.\nIf the target is holding a Berry, the\nBerry becomes burnt up and unusable.

name: TM60
description: The user suppresses the target and\nmakes its move go last.

name: TM61
description: The user shoots a sinister, bluish-white\nflame at the target to inflict a burn.

name: TM62
description: The user nimbly strikes the target.\nIf the user is not holding an item,\nthis attack inflicts massive damage.

name: TM63
description: It prevents the target from using its\nheld item. Its Trainer is also prevented\nfrom using items on it.

name: TM64
description: The user explodes to inflict damage on\nthose around it.\nThe user faints upon using this move.

name: TM65
description: The user slashes with a sharp claw\nmade from shadows. It has a high\ncritical-hit ratio.

name: TM66
description: The user stores power, then attacks.\nIf the user can use this attack after\nthe target, its power is doubled.

name: TM67
description: The user gets revenge for a fainted\nally. If an ally fainted in the previous\nturn, this attack's damage increases.

name: TM68
description: The user charges at the target using\nevery bit of its power.\nThe user must rest on the next turn.

name: TM69
description: The user polishes its body to reduce\ndrag. It sharply raises the Speed\nstat.

name: TM70
description: The user flashes a bright light that\ncuts the target's accuracy.\nIt can also be used to illuminate caves.

name: TM71
description: The user stabs the foe with\nsharpened stones from below.\nIt has a high critical-hit ratio.

name: TM72
description: After making its attack, the user\nrushes back to switch places with\na party Pokémon in waiting.

name: TM73
description: A weak electric charge is launched\nat the target. It causes paralysis\nif it hits.

name: TM74
description: The user tackles the target with a\nhigh-speed spin. The slower the\nuser, the greater the damage.

name: TM75
description: A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting\nspirit. It sharply raises the user's\nAttack stat.

name: TM76
description: Resisting, the user attacks the\nopposing Pokémon. The targets' Sp. Atk\nstat is reduced.

name: TM77
description: The user hypnotizes itself into\ncopying any stat change made\nby the target.

name: TM78
description: The user stomps down on the ground\nand attacks everything in the area.\nThe targets' Speed stat is reduced.

name: TM79
description: The user blows a cold breath on the\ntarget. This attack always results in\na critical hit.

name: TM80
description: Large boulders are hurled at the\nopposing team to inflict damage. They \nmay also make the targets flinch.

name: TM81
description: The user slashes at the target by\ncrossing its scythes or claws as if\nthey were a pair of scissors.

name: TM82
description: The user knocks away the target and\ndrags out another Pokémon in its party.\nIn the wild, the battle ends.

name: TM83
description: The user is roused, and its Attack\nand Sp. Atk stats increase.

name: TM84
description: The target is stabbed with a tentacle\nor arm steeped in poison. It may also\npoison the target.

name: TM85
description: The user eats the dreams of a sleeping\ntarget. It absorbs half the damage\ncaused to heal the user's HP.

name: TM86
description: The user snares the target with grass\nand trips it. The heavier the target,\nthe greater the damage.

name: TM87
description: The user enrages and confuses the\ntarget. However, it also sharply raises\nthe target's Attack stat.

name: TM88
description: The user pecks the target. If the\ntarget is holding a Berry, the user\nplucks it and gains its effect.

name: TM89
description: After making its attack, the user\nrushes back to switch places with a\nparty Pokémon in waiting.

name: TM90
description: The user makes a copy of itself using\nsome of its HP. The copy serves as\nthe user's decoy.

name: TM91
description: The user gathers all its light energy\nand releases it at once. It may also\nlower the target's Sp. Def stat.

name: TM92
description: The user creates a bizarre space in\nwhich slower Pokémon get to move\nfirst for five turns.

name: HM01
description: The target is cut with a scythe or claw.\nIt can also be used to cut down thin\ntrees.

name: HM02
description: The user soars, then strikes on the\nsecond turn. It can also be used to\nfly to any familiar town.

name: HM03
description: It swamps the area around the user\nwith a giant wave.\nIt can also be used for crossing water.

name: HM04
description: The target is slugged with a punch\nthrown at maximum power. This move can\nalso be used to move boulders.

name: HM05
description: The user charges the target at an\nawesome speed. It can also be used\nto climb a waterfall.

name: HM06
description: Diving on the first turn, the user\nfloats up and attacks on the second.\nIt can be used for diving in the ocean.

name: Explorer Kit
description: A bag filled with convenient tools\nfor exploring. It provides access to\nthe Underground.

name: Loot Sack
description: A sturdy, spacious bag that is used\nto carry loot obtained in the coal\nmine.

name: Rule Book
description: It lists the rules for holding battles.\nFor linked battles, you may choose\nwhich set of rules you wish to use.

name: Poké Radar
description: A tool that can search out Pokémon\nthat are hiding in grass. Its battery is\nrecharged as you walk.

name: Point Card
description: A card that lists the Battle Points\nyou have earned.\n

name: Journal
description: A notebook that keeps a day-to-day\nrecord of your adventure so far.\n

name: Seal Case
description: A case for storing Seals that can be\napplied to the Capsule cases of\nPoké Balls.

name: Fashion Case
description: A lovely case to store colorful Props\nfor your Pokémon to wear in a musical.

name: Seal Bag
description: A tiny bag that can hold ten Seals for\ndecorating Poké Balls.

name: Pal Pad
description: A convenient notepad that is used for\nregistering your friends, Friend Codes,\nand keeping a record of game play.

name: Works Key
description: A large key for operating the doors of\nthe Valley Windworks in the canyon.\nIt was held by a Team Galactic Grunt.

name: Old Charm
description: An ancient good-luck charm made of\nPokémon bones to be taken to the elder\nof Celestic Town.

name: Galactic Key
description: A card key for disengaging security\nsystems in the Galactic HQ. Losing it\ncan result in punishment, apparently.

name: Red Chain
description: A mythical chain that is said to link\nthe legendary Pokémon that created\nthe Sinnoh region.

name: Town Map
description: A very convenient map that can be\nviewed anytime. It even shows your\npresent location.

name: Vs. Seeker
description: A device that indicates Trainers who\nwant to battle. Its battery charges\nwhile you walk.

name: Coin Case
description: A case for holding coins obtained at\nthe Game Corner.\nIt holds up to 50,000 coins.

name: Old Rod
description: An old and beat-up fishing rod.\nUse it by any body of water to fish for\nwild aquatic Pokémon.

name: Good Rod
description: A new, good-quality fishing rod.\nUse it by any body of water to fish for\nwild aquatic Pokémon.

name: Super Rod
description: An awesome, high-tech fishing rod.\nUse it by any body of water to fish for\nwild aquatic Pokémon.

name: Sprayduck
description: A watering can shaped like a Psyduck.\nIt helps promote healthy growth of\nBerries planted in soft soil.

name: Poffin Case
description: A case for storing Poffin cooked from\nBerries.\n

name: Bicycle
description: A folding Bicycle that enables much\nfaster movement than the Running\nShoes.

name: Suite Key
description: A key to one of the suites at the\nluxury hotel by a lake. For some odd\nreason, it often disappears.

name: Oak's Letter
description: A letter from Prof. Oak.\nWritten in it is a request for you to\ngo to Rt. 224.

name: Lunar Wing
description: A feather that glows like the moon.\nIt is said to possess the power to\ndispel nightmares.

name: Member Card
description: A card needed for entering the inn in\nCanalave City. Oddly, the last date\nmarked on it was 50 years ago.

name: Azure Flute
description: A flute that puts out echoing sounds\nthat do not seem to be of this world.\nIt is unknown who made it.

name: S.S. Ticket
description: The ticket required for sailing on the\nferry S.S. Aqua. It has a drawing of a\nship on it.

name: Contest Pass
description: The pass required for entering Pokémon\nContests. It has a drawing of an award\nribbon on it.

name: Magma Stone
description: A stone formed when boulders melted in\nintensely hot magma, then hardened.\nMagma remains sealed inside.

name: Parcel
description: A parcel entrusted in your care.\nYou are supposed to deliver it to your\nchildhood friend who left Twinleaf Town.

name: Coupon 1
description: A coupon to be exchanged for a\nPokémon Watch (Pokétch for short).\nThree coupons are needed.

name: Coupon 2
description: A coupon to be exchanged for a\nPokémon Watch (Pokétch for short).\nThree coupons are needed.

name: Coupon 3
description: A coupon to be exchanged for a\nPokémon Watch (Pokétch for short).\nThree coupons are needed.

name: Storage Key
description: The key to Team Galactic's sinister\nwarehouse located at the edge of\nVeilstone City.

name: SecretPotion
description: A fantastic medicine dispensed by the\npharmacy in Cianwood City. It fully\nheals a Pokémon of any ailment.

name: Vs. Recorder
description: An amazing device that can record a\nbattle either between friends or at a\nspecial battle facility.

name: Gracidea
description: A flower sometimes bundled in bouquets\nto convey gratitude on special\noccasions like birthdays.

name: Secret Key
description: A high-tech key that has to be used at\na specific location. It emits a special\nelectric signal to open a door.

name: Apricorn Box
description: A handy box where you can store up to\n99 Apricorns of each kind.

name: Unown Report
description: A report of all the discovered kinds\nof Unown.

name: Berry Pots
description: Handy containers for cultivating\nBerries wherever you go.

name: Dowsing MCHN
description: It checks for unseen items in the area\nand makes noise and lights when it\nfinds something.

name: Blue Card
description: A card to save points for the\nBuena's Password show.

name: SlowpokeTail
description: A very tasty tail of something.\nIt sells for a high price.

name: Clear Bell
description: A very old-fashioned bell that makes a\ngentle ringing.

name: Card Key
description: A card key that opens a shutter in the\nRadio Tower.

name: Basement Key
description: A key that opens a door in the\nGoldenrod Tunnel.

name: SquirtBottle
description: A bottle used for watering plants in the\nBerry Pots.

name: Red Scale
description: A scale from the red Gyarados. It glows\nred like a flame.

name: Lost Item
description: The Mime Jr. doll that was lost by\nthe Copycat.

name: Pass
description: A ticket required for riding the Magnet\nTrain. It allows you to ride whenever\nand however much you'd like.

name: Machine Part
description: An important machine part for the\nPower Plant that was stolen.

name: Silver Wing
description: A strange, silvery feather\nthat sparkles.

name: Rainbow Wing
description: A mystical rainbow feather\nthat sparkles.

name: Mystery Egg
description: A mysterious Egg obtained from Mr.\nPokémon. What's in the Egg is unknown.

name: Red Apricorn
description: A red Apricorn.\nIt assails your nostrils.

name: Blu Apricorn
description: A blue Apricorn.\nIt smells a bit like grass.

name: Ylw Apricorn
description: A yellow Apricorn.\nIt has an invigorating scent.

name: Grn Apricorn
description: A green Apricorn.\nIt has a mysterious, aromatic scent.

name: Pnk Apricorn
description: A pink Apricorn.\nIt has a nice, sweet scent.

name: Wht Apricorn
description: A white Apricorn.\nIt doesn't smell like anything.

name: Blk Apricorn
description: A black Apricorn\nIt has an indescribable scent.

name: Fast Ball
description: A Poké Ball that makes it easier to\ncatch Pokémon which are quick to\nrun away.

name: Level Ball
description: A Poké Ball for catching Pokémon that\nare a lower level than your own.

name: Lure Ball
description: A Poké Ball for catching Pokémon hooked\nby a Rod when fishing.

name: Heavy Ball
description: A Poké Ball for catching very heavy\nPokémon.

name: Love Ball
description: Poké Ball for catching Pokémon that are\nthe opposite gender of your Pokémon.

name: Friend Ball
description: A Poké Ball that makes caught Pokémon\nmore friendly.

name: Moon Ball
description: A Poké Ball for catching Pokémon that\nevolve using the Moon Stone.

name: Sport Ball
description: A special Poké Ball for the\nBug-Catching Contest.

name: Park Ball
description: A special Poké Ball for the Pal Park.

name: Photo Album
description: A nice photo album for storing all the\nphotos taken along your adventure.

name: GB Sounds
description: A music player that allows you to listen\nto nostalgic songs. It's operated with\na single switch.

name: Tidal Bell
description: A very old-fashioned bell that makes a\ngentle ringing.

name: RageCandyBar
description: A famous Mahogany Town candy tourists\nlike to buy and take home. It restores\nthe HP of one Pokémon by 20 points.

name: Data Card 01
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many victories\nyou've had.

name: Data Card 02
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many\nlosses you've had.

name: Data Card 03
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many times your\nPokémon have dashed.

name: Data Card 04
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many times your\nPokémon have jumped.

name: Data Card 05
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many times you've\nwon the Hurdle Dash.

name: Data Card 06
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many times you've\nwon the Relay Run.

name: Data Card 07
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many times you've\nwon Pennant Capture.

name: Data Card 08
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many times you've\nwon Block Smash.

name: Data Card 09
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many times you've\nwon Disc Catch.

name: Data Card 10
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many times you've\nwon Snow Throw.

name: Data Card 11
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many points\nyour Pokémon scored.

name: Data Card 12
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many times your\nPokémon have failed.

name: Data Card 13
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many times your\nPokémon impeded themselves.

name: Data Card 14
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many times your\nPokémon have tackled.

name: Data Card 15
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many times your\nPokémon have fallen down.

name: Data Card 16
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many times you've\nwon Ring Drop.

name: Data Card 17
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many times you've\nwon Lamp Jump.

name: Data Card 18
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many times you've\nwon Circle Push.

name: Data Card 19
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many \nLink Pokéathlon wins you've had.

name: Data Card 20
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many\nLink Pokéathlon losses you've had.

name: Data Card 21
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many times\nyou've won an event.

name: Data Card 22
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many times \nyou've lost an event.

name: Data Card 23
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many times you've\nswitched Pokémon.

name: Data Card 24
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many times you've\nwon Goal Roll.

name: Data Card 25
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many times your\nPokémon won individual prizes.

name: Data Card 26
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how many times you've\ninstructed your Pokémon.

name: Data Card 27
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a\ncard that shows how much time you've\nspent in the Pokéathlon.

name: Jade Orb
description: A shiny green orb that is said to have\na legend and has a deep connection with\nthe Hoenn region.

name: Lock Capsule
description: A sturdy Capsule that can only be\nopened with a special key.

name: Red Orb
description: A shiny red orb that is said to have\na legend and has a deep connection with\nthe Hoenn region.

name: Blue Orb
description: A shiny blue orb that is said to have\na legend and has a deep connection with\nthe Hoenn region.

name: Enigma Stone
description: A crystal ball that was excavated from\nthe ground. A very beautiful stone that\nis covered with bits of rock and earth.

name: Prism Scale
description: A mysterious scale that evolves\ncertain Pokémon.\nIt shines in rainbow colors.

name: Eviolite
description: A mysterious evolutionary lump. When\nheld, it raises the Defense and Sp. Def\nof a Pokémon that can still evolve.

name: Float Stone
description: A very light stone. It reduces the\nweight of a Pokémon when held.

name: Rocky Helmet
description: If the holder of this item takes damage,\nthe attacker will also be damaged\nupon contact.

name: Air Balloon
description: When held by a Pokémon, the Pokémon\nwill float into the air. When the holder\nis attacked, this item will burst.

name: Red Card
description: A card with a mysterious power. When\nthe holder is struck by a foe, the\nattacker is removed from battle.

name: Ring Target

name: Binding Band
description: A band that increases the power of\nbinding moves when held.

name: Absorb Bulb
description: A consumable bulb. If the holder is hit\nby a Water-type move, its Sp. Atk\nwill rise.

name: Cell Battery
description: A consumable battery. If the\nholder is hit by an Electric-type\nmove, its Attack will rise.

name: Eject Button
description: If the holder is hit by an attack, it will\nswitch with another Pokémon in\nyour party.

name: Fire Gem
description: A gem with an essence of fire. When\nheld, it strengthens the power of a\nFire-type move only once.

name: Water Gem
description: A gem with an essence of water. When\nheld, it strengthens the power of a\nWater-type move only once.

name: Electric Gem

name: Grass Gem

name: Ice Gem
description: A gem with an essence of ice. When held,\nit strengthens the power of an\nIce-type move only once.

name: Fighting Gem

name: Poison Gem

name: Ground Gem

name: Flying Gem

name: Psychic Gem

name: Bug Gem

name: Rock Gem

name: Ghost Gem

name: Dragon Gem

name: Dark Gem

name: Steel Gem

name: Normal Gem
description: A gem with an ordinary essence. When\nheld, it strengthens the power of a\nNormal-type move only once.

name: Health Wing
description: An item for use on a Pokémon. It\nslightly increases the base HP of a\nsingle Pokémon.

name: Muscle Wing
description: An item for use on a Pokémon. It\nslightly increases the base Attack stat\nof a single Pokémon.

name: Resist Wing
description: An item for use on a Pokémon. It\nslightly increases the base Defense\nstat of a single Pokémon.

name: Genius Wing
description: An item for use on a Pokémon. It\nslightly increases the base Sp. Atk\nstat of a single Pokémon.

name: Clever Wing
description: An item for use on a Pokémon. It\nslightly increases the base Sp. Def\nstat of a single Pokémon.

name: Swift Wing
description: An item for use on a Pokémon. It\nslightly increases the base Speed stat\nof a single Pokémon.

name: Pretty Wing
description: Though this feather is beautiful, it's\njust a regular feather and has no\neffect on Pokémon.

name: Cover Fossil
description: A fossil of an ancient Pokémon that\nlived in the sea in ancient times.\nIt appears to be part of its back.

name: Plume Fossil
description: A fossil of an ancient Pokémon that\nflew in the sky in ancient times.\nIt appears to be part of its wing.

name: Liberty Pass

name: Dragon Skull

name: BalmMushroom

name: Big Nugget

name: Pearl String

name: Comet Shard

name: Relic Crown

description: It sharply raises the Attack stat of a\nPokémon in battle. It wears off if the\nPokémon is withdrawn.

description: It drastically raises the Speed stat of\na Pokémon in battle. It wears off if the\nPokémon is withdrawn.

description: It drastically raises the Sp. Atk stat\nof a Pokémon in battle. It wears off if\nthe Pokémon is withdrawn.

name: Ability Urge

name: Reset Urge
description: When used, it restores any stat\nchanges of an ally Pokémon.

name: Dire Hit 3
description: It can be used many times to greatly\nraise a Pokémon's critical-hit ratio. It\nwears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

name: Light Stone
description: Reshiram's body was destroyed and\nchanged into this stone. It is said to\nbe waiting for the emergence of a hero.

name: Dark Stone
description: Zekrom's body was destroyed and\nchanged into this stone. It is said to\nbe waiting for the emergence of a hero.

name: TM93
description: The user shrouds itself in electricity\nand smashes into its target.\nIt also damages the user a little.

name: TM94
description: The user attacks with a punch that can\nshatter a rock. It may also lower the\ntarget's Defense stat.

name: TM95
description: The user yells as if it is ranting about\nsomething, making the target's Sp. Atk\nstat decrease.

name: Xtransceiver
description: A high-tech transceiver with a \ncamera function. It allows up to\nfour-way calls.

name: Gram 1
description: An important letter which\nWingull delivers.

name: Gram 2
description: An important letter which\nWingull delivers.

name: Gram 3
description: An important letter which\nWingull delivers.

name: Xtransceiver
description: A high-tech transceiver with a\ncamera function. It allows up to\nfour-way calls.

name: Master Ball
description: Assurément la Ball la plus performante.\nElle permet de capturer à coup sûr un\nPokémon sauvage.

name: Hyper Ball
description: Une Ball ultraperformante dont le taux\nde réussite est supérieur à celui de la\nSuper Ball.

name: Super Ball
description: Une Ball très performante dont le taux\nde réussite est supérieur à celui de la\nPoké Ball.

name: Poké Ball

name: Safari Ball
description: Une Poké Ball spéciale dont l'usage\nest réservé au Parc Safari. Elle est\ndécorée d'un motif camouflage.

name: Filet Ball
description: Une Poké Ball un peu spéciale qui\nfonctionne particulièrement bien\nsur les Pokémon Eau ou Insecte.

name: Scuba Ball

name: Faiblo Ball

name: Chrono Ball

name: Luxe Ball

name: Honor Ball

name: Mémoire Ball
description: Une Poké Ball plutôt rare qui fut créée\npour une occasion spéciale.

name: Potion
description: Un spray qui soigne les blessures.\nRestaure 20 PV à un Pokémon.

name: Antidote

name: Anti-Brûle

name: Réveil

name: Anti-Para

name: Total Soin

name: Soda Cool

name: Lait Meumeu

name: Poudrénergie

name: Calcium

name: Super Bonbon

name: PP Plus

name: Vitesse +

name: Spécial +

name: Fertipousse
description: Un engrais utilisé sur sol meuble.\nLes amateurs en donnent un bon prix.

name: Fertihumide
description: Un engrais utilisé sur sol meuble.\nLes amateurs en donnent un bon prix.

name: Fertistable
description: Un engrais utilisé sur sol meuble.\nLes amateurs en donnent un bon prix.

name: Fertiglu
description: Un engrais utilisé sur sol meuble.\nLes amateurs en donnent un bon prix.

name: Nautile
description: Fossile d'un ancien Pokémon aquatique.\nOn dirait un morceau de coquillage.

name: Fossile Dôme
description: Fossile d'un ancien Pokémon aquatique.\nOn dirait un morceau de carapace.

name: Foss. Crâne

name: Pierre Éclat

name: Pierre Nuit

name: Pierre Aube

name: Pierre Ovale

name: Orbe Perlé

name: Lettre Salut

name: Lettre Merci

name: Let. Demande

name: Lettre Avis

name: Let. Réponse

name: Baie Pommo
description: Tenue, cette Baie inflige des dégâts\nà l'ennemi s'il utilise une attaque\nspéciale qui atteint son but.

name: Poudreclaire

name: Herbeblanche
description: Objet à tenir qui restaure les stats\nbaissées. Ne peut être utilisé qu'une\nfois.

name: Brac. Macho
description: Objet à tenir. C'est un bracelet dur\net lourd qui rend le porteur plus fort,\nmais baisse sa Vitesse.

name: Multi Exp
description: Objet à tenir. Le porteur reçoit une\npartie des points Exp. du combat sans\navoir à combattre.

name: Vive Griffe
description: Objet à tenir. Griffe légère mais\ntranchante qui permet parfois de\nfrapper le premier.

name: Grelot Zen
description: Objet à tenir. Grelot dont le carillon\ncalme le porteur et favorise l'amitié.

name: Herbe Mental
description: Objet à tenir qui annule l'attirance\nd'un Pokémon. Ne peut être utilisé\nqu'une fois.

name: Band. Choix
description: Objet à tenir. Ce bandeau monte\nl'Attaque, mais ne permet d'utiliser\nqu'une seule capacité par combat.

name: Roche Royale
description: Objet à tenir. Peut apeurer l'ennemi\nlorsque le porteur lui inflige des\ndégâts.

name: Poudre Arg.
description: Objet à tenir. Poudre d'argent\nbrillante qui monte la puissance\ndes capacités de type Insecte.

name: Pièce Rune
description: Objet à tenir. Double l'argent gagné\nsi le porteur se joint au combat.

name: Rune Purif.
description: Objet à tenir. Aide à repousser les\nPokémon sauvages si le porteur est\nle premier Pokémon de l'équipe.

name: Rosée Âme
description: Orbe prodigieux à faire tenir à Latios\nou Latias qui monte leur Attaque\nSpéciale et leur Défense Spéciale.

name: Dent Océan
description: Objet à faire tenir à Coquiperl.\nDent de couleur argent montant\nson Attaque Spéciale.

name: Écailleocéan
description: Objet à faire tenir à Coquiperl.\nÉcaille de couleur rose montant\nsa Défense Spéciale.

name: Boule Fumée
description: Objet à tenir. Permet au porteur de\ns'enfuir à coup sûr face à un Pokémon\nsauvage.

name: Pierre Stase
description: Objet à tenir. Pierre merveilleuse\nempêchant l'évolution.

name: Bandeau
description: Objet à tenir pouvant parfois empêcher\nd'être mis K.O., ne laissant qu'un PV.

name: Œuf Chance
description: Objet à tenir. Œuf rempli de joie qui\naugmente le nombre de points Exp.\ngagnés au combat.

name: Lentilscope
description: Objet à tenir. Lentille qui augmente le\ntaux de critiques du porteur.

name: Peau Métal
description: Objet à tenir. Pellicule métallique\nspéciale qui monte la puissance des\ncapacités de type Acier.

name: Restes
description: Objet à tenir permettant de restaurer\nles PV du porteur graduellement durant\nle combat.

name: Écailledraco
description: Une écaille épaisse et dure tenue\nparfois par les Pokémon de type Dragon\nquand ils sont attrapés.

name: Ballelumière
description: Objet à faire tenir par Pikachu. Orbe\nénigmatique qui monte son Attaque et\nson Attaque Spéciale.

name: Sable Doux
description: Objet à tenir. Sable fin et soyeux\nmontant la puissance des capacités\nde type Sol.

name: Pierre Dure
description: Objet à tenir. Pierre incassable qui\nmonte la puissance des capacités de\ntype Roche.

name: Grain Miracl
description: Objet à tenir. Graine remplie de vie qui\nmonte la puissance des capacités de\ntype Plante.

name: Lunet.Noires
description: Objet à tenir. Paire de lunettes à\nl'aspect louche qui monte la puissance\ndes capacités de type Ténèbres.

name: Ceint.Noire
description: Objet à tenir. Ceinture qui augmente\nla détermination et la puissance des\ncapacités de type Combat.

name: Aimant
description: Objet à tenir. Aimant puissant montant\nla puissance des capacités de type\nÉlectrik.

name: Eau Mystique

name: Bec Pointu
description: Objet à tenir. Bec long et pointu\nmontant la puissance des capacités\nde type Vol.

name: Pic Venin
description: Objet à tenir. Petit pic empoisonné\nmontant la puissance des capacités\nde type Poison.

name: Glacéternel
description: Objet à tenir. Morceau de glace qui\nréfléchit la chaleur et monte la\npuissance des capacités de type Glace.

name: Rune Sort
description: Objet à tenir. Plaque sinistre et\nétrange montant la puissance des\ncapacités de type Spectre.

name: Cuillertordu
description: Objet à tenir. Cuillère contenant un\npouvoir télékinésique montant la\npuissance des capacités de type Psy.

name: Charbon
description: Objet à tenir. Combustible montant la\npuissance des capacités de type Feu.

name: Croc Dragon
description: Objet à tenir. Croc dur et pointu\nmontant la puissance des capacités\nde type Dragon.

name: Mouch. Soie

name: Améliorator

description: Objet à tenir. Encens au parfum curieux\nqui augmente la puissance des capacités\nde type Eau.

name: Poing Chance
description: Objet à faire tenir à Leveinard. Paire\nde gants montant son taux de critiques.

name: Poudre Métal
description: Objet à faire tenir à Métamorph. Cette\npoudre étrange, très fine mais\nrésistante, booste sa Défense.

description: Objet à faire tenir à Osselait ou\nOssatueur. Os dur qui monte leur\nAttaque.

name: Bâton

name: Poudre Vite

name: Roche Chaude

name: Roche Humide

name: Mouch. Choix

name: Poids Pouv.

name: Carapace Mue

name: Grosseracine

name: Lunet. Choix
description: Objet à tenir augmentant l'Attaque\nSpéciale, mais ne permettant d'utiliser\nqu'une seule capacité par combat.

description: Objet à tenir. Tablette en pierre\naugmentant la puissance des capacités\nde type Poison.

description: Objet à tenir. Tablette en pierre\naugmentant la puissance des capacités\nde type Sol.

description: Objet à tenir. Tablette en pierre\naugmentant la puissance des capacités\nde type Vol.

name: Plaquesprit
description: Objet à tenir. Tablette en pierre\naugmentant la puissance des capacités\nde type Psy.

name: Plaquinsect
description: Objet à tenir. Tablette en pierre\naugmentant la puissance des capacités\nde type Insecte.
